title:
Bitcoin Peaks At Highest Value In 2 Months Above $65,000: Bull Run Predictions 
						For the first time in nearly two months, Bitcoin (BTC) has surpassed the $65,000 mark, marking a significant recovery following...
author: Unknown
summary:
Hey everyone! Exciting news in the crypto world as Bitcoin (BTC) has just crossed the $65,000 mark for the first time in nearly two months, signaling a notable recovery after facing two hefty downturns in August and September. Analysts are buzzing with optimism as we head into October—historically a strong month for Bitcoin, with average returns around 22.90%. Some are even speculating that if this trend continues, we could see Bitcoin shoot up to around $79,000!

Scott Melker, a well-known crypto investor, pointed out that Bitcoin is working to establish its first higher high since it peaked at $74,000 back in March. He emphasized that if BTC can hold above $65,000, it could confirm a new upward trend, shifting us from the lows experienced in August. Meanwhile, Rekt Capital highlighted that September was surprisingly positive for Bitcoin, marking it as the best September on record with a 9% increase. With Bitcoin currently in the sweet spot—159 days post its last halving—many believe a significant breakout could be on the horizon.

As if that wasn't enough, the recent dovish stance from the US Federal Reserve and fresh inflows into Bitcoin ETFs are adding fuel to this bullish fire. With BlackRock's ETF seeing substantial inflows, there's a growing sense that the market might be gearing up for a powerful rally into the final months of the year. So, what do you all think? Are we on the brink of a new bull run, or is there more volatility ahead?
